samOptiPro 0.1.0
  • Reference

Profile sampler times per node/family

Source: R/diagnostics.R
profile_sampler_times.Rd

Usage

profile_sampler_times(
  model,
  conf,
  niter = 2000L,
  burnin = 500L,
  thin = 1L,
  set_seed = NULL,
  progress = FALSE
)

profile_sampler_times(
  model,
  conf,
  niter = 2000L,
  burnin = 500L,
  thin = 1L,
  set_seed = NULL,
  progress = FALSE
)

Arguments

model

nimbleModel (uncompiled), initialized.

conf

MCMC configuration from nimble::configureMCMC(model, ...).

niter

Total iterations including burn-in.

burnin

Number of warm-up iterations before timing.

thin

Thinning interval (\(\ge\) 1). If > 1, extra sweeps are advanced without timing.

set_seed

Integer or NULL; if not NULL, set.seed() for reproducibility.

progress

Logical; print simple 10\

cmodelA compiled nimbleModel.

mcmc_confAn MCMC configuration (e.g., nimble::configureMCMC(model)). If NULL, an automatic attempt is made.

include_dataLogical; include data nodes (default FALSE).

removed_nodesCharacter vector; nodes to exclude (e.g., ESS = 0).

ignore_patternsCharacter vector; regex to ignore (default c("^lifted_", "^logProb_")).

plot_dependenciesLogical; if TRUE, barplot (ggplot2) of medians per family.

output_dirCharacter or NULL; directory for CSV/PNG exports (NULL = no export).

save_csvLogical; if TRUE, write dependencies_per_node.csv to output_dir.

node_of_interestCharacter or NULL; node whose filtered downstream deps are requested.

npNumeric in (0,1]; proportion for prop_worst = ceil(n_samplers * np) (default 0.10).

...Additional arguments passed to nimble::configureMCMC() (e.g., print = FALSE, useConjugacy = FALSE).

A list with (at least) data frames per node/family and (optionally) ggplot objects.A list: 


  (stochastic_nodes, deterministic_nodes, dims, nodes = NULL,
   dependencies_df, dep_counts, dep_summary, plot_regular,
   node_of_interest_deps,
   samplers_df, n_samplers, prop_worst,
   mcmc_conf)  # configuration created internally
Profile per-sampler elapsed times (uncompiled MCMC, R-level granularity)A numeric vector of length length(conf$getSamplers()), aligned with the sampler order returned by conf$getSamplers(). Units are seconds.Profile per-sampler elapsed times (uncompiled MCMC, R-level granularity)Builds an uncompiled MCMC and measures wall-clock time spent in each sampler by instrumenting calls to each samplerFunction$run() over a short run.Numeric vector of length length(conf$getSamplers()), seconds per sampler (aligned by index). profile_sampler_times Analyze a NIMBLE model: stochastic/deterministic nodes, dimensions, downstream dependencies (ignoring artificial nodes), and samplers (type & targets) from an MCMC configuration built internally via nimble::configureMCMC(model, ...).Artificial nodes lifted_*, logProb_*, and removed_nodes are ignored everywhere. Optionally: CSV export and ggplot2 barplot of medians of dependencies by stats::family(with labels = count).Build an uncompiled MCMC (nimble::buildMCMC(conf)) and measure wall-clock elapsed time spent in each sampler by instrumenting calls to sampler$run() over a short run. This preserves per-sampler granularity, which is lost in compiled MCMC. internal
